result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin R. Widowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: With huber for work, school, treatment, child care, methadone clinic, or a combination. 45 days to report.
Any vehicle titled or registered in defendant's name is subject to IID as is the defendant himseld. Half Priced IID.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Case called:  3:00 pm
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Pauline Toulouse;
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
Delete "Repeater" enhancer on Ct. 1.
15TR5138 DEEMED REFUSAL REASONABLE.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (OWI 2nd)>> NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS:  $1429 fine inclusive of Court Costs and DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample, 5 Days MCJ w/Huber for work/school/treatment/child care/methadone clinic or a combination, 
Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 12 months, as is the defendant himself, and device to be installed immediately; 1/2 price IID installation fee to be paid; 12 month dl revocation; AODA. Defendant has 45 days to report to MCJ.

Adjourned: 3:08 pm

Pre-trial conference at 12-14-2015 01:40 pm.
Final pre-trial at 01-21-2016 02:30 pm.
Jury Trial at 02-09-2016 09:00 am.

Shall not consume alcohol.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Absolute sobriety.    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 on or before 11/23/2015.
